isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992 - 1993 - ECM DIAGNOSTICS - DIAGNOSTIC SYSTEM

svcprocinfo.para: A diagnostic check may be performed using the Diagnostic ON/OFF switch or Pro Link EST.

svcsubproc.title: Using Diagnostic ON/OFF Switch
svcsubproc.para: Any fault codes will be flashed through the yellow Check Engine Light. If no fault codes are logged, the code "25" will be flashed out on the yellow Check Engine Light. Refer to the Detroit Diesel Engine Manual furnished with the vehicle for the exact procedure and explanation of the flash codes.

note.para: The diagnostic switch must NOT be operated when driving the vehicle. If this is done, the diagnostic mode will be entered, and the engine will be forced to idle speed, affecting vehicle operation.

svcsubproc.para: To display flash codes, use the following procedure:

step1.para: Begin procedure with the engine OFF.
Turn the ignition key switch to the RUN position (not Crank).
Hold the Diagnostic Switch in the ON position.
The first fault code will begin flashing on the yellow Check Engine Light.

svcsubproc.para: For example, the yellow engine warning light blinks out: FLASH, FLASH. The first digit is a 2, then a half-second pause: FLASH FLASH, FLASH, FLASH, FLASH. The second digit is a 5. Code 25 is System OK.

note.para: All Series 60 fault codes are 2 digits.

step1.para: If more than one fault code is logged, there will be a three second pause between flashes. All active codes will continue to flash in sequence until the diagnostics are turned off.
To stop the diagnostics, release the diagnostic switch. Remember to turn off the ignition.

svcsubproc.para: The Detroit Diesel Operators Engine Manual furnished with the vehicle contains flash code descriptions. The Detroit Diesel Troubleshooting Manual contains flash code descriptions and diagnostic procedures.
If the fault code(s) or symptoms indicate a need to troubleshoot a International installed circuit or component, procedures are included in Troubleshooting in this chapter.

svcsubproc.title: MPSI Pro Link Electronic Service Tool (EST)
svcsubproc.para: The Pro Link EST with a Series 60 cartridge can be used to read logged fault codes and monitor many of the system switches and operating parameters. Refer to the Pro Link manual for information on using the EST.
International vehicles include an 8-way and 12-way (for DDEC EST) diagnostic connector used to access the system with an EST.

svcsubproc.title: Service Information
svcsubproc.para: To obtain Detroit Diesel Engine Service information, contact your local Detroit Diesel Distributor.
